What problem exactly do you run into? 

When I did this, the Junit program as such ran with no problem, but 
it could not find the demo testcases: to find those I needed to add . 
(DOT, current directory) to CLASSPATH as well.

BTW when running the swing ui, Junit crashes when I click on the 
button that should allow you to browse to your testcase. Anyone else 
have this too? Fixes? Workarounds?



--- In junit@y..., yjin68@y... wrote:
> Hi, everyone,
> 
> This's the first time for me to use Junit, because I need to use it 
> for my project. But I met a problem, when I download Junit3.5 form 
> http://www.junit.org, and set my class path to be:
> set CLASSPATH=c:\install-dir\junit\junit.jar;%CLASSPATH% 
> after that, I'm wonder whether I need to set classpath for 
> junit.textui.TestRunner (or junit.ui.TestRunner) or not. If I need 
to 
> set the classpath, how to set them? Can anyone help me? Thanks a lot
subject: Re: A trouble to run Junit
